resources.string: You have denied the write permission :(\nIn order to add covers or to export/import your library, we need it. Do you want to accept this permission?
You have denied the camera permission :(\nIn order to scan barcodes and take photos, we need it. Do you want to accept this permission?
Create the corresponding Excel file MyLibrary.xls
Create the corresponding Excel file MyLibraryByAuthor.xls
This book is already in your library. Do you want to add it anyway?
This comic is already in your library. Do you want to add it anyway?
Open app settings to accept the permission
I don\'t want to use these features, close this pop-up
I don\'t want to use this feature, close this pop-up
There is no web browser installed on your phone
You are going to export your current library. If it is not your first export, this library is going to erase the previous one.
Save the covers in the corresponding file MyLibraryImages.txt

WARNING: be aware that the export will take much more time and that exporting your covers will result in a really big file (usually about 1.5Mo for every 10 elements, but it can be more). Please be sure that you have enough space on your phone or the export will probably fail. MyLibraryImages.txt is used to import images when you select this option in the import dialog.
Please select at least one export type
You are going to import a library you previously exported. To complete this import, you need to have a previously saved file \'mylibrary.db\' or \'MyLibrary.xls\' in your \'Download\' directory.
Warning : your current covers will be replaced by the imported ones
Warning : as you\'re importing your database from an Excel file, you need to check this box if you want your new imports to have covers
Warning : your current library is going to be erased by the imported one
Warning : merging current and imported libraries can result in doubles
This action will erase all your library with no hope of recovery.\nAre you sure you want to do this?
Your library has been saved in your Download directory
The library has been successfully recovered!
It is impossible to write data on your phone!
An error has occurred during XLS file creation
An error has occurred during Images Text file creation
There is no \'mylibrary.db\' file in your download directory
The \'mylibrary.db\' file in your download directory is not compatible with My Library.\nPlease, be sure to only import in My Library a file you previously exported with My Library.
The \'mylibrary.db\' file in your download directory is not a valid library
There is no %s file in your \'Download\' directory
There is no sheet named \"%1$s\" nor sheet named \"%2$s\" in your \"%3$s\" file.
There is no \"%1$s\" column in your \"%2$s\" sheet. This column is mandatory.
\"%1$s\" column of the \"%2$s\" sheet has a blank field at line %3$d. Blank fields are not allowed for this column.
Your %s file is corrupted and cannot be read.

You cannot deceive a developer :)\n\nYour MyLibrary.xls file is in reality an .XLSX file (like MyLibrary.xlsx) that you renamed MyLibrary.xls. XLSX files are not compatible with XLS import. In Excel, select file -> save as -> XLS file to get a real XLS file to import.
Your MyLibrary.xls file is an Excel 5.0 or Excel 7.0 file. My Library only supports XLS files from Excel 97 and later versions.
Convert book to comic / comic to book
Click here to add a book to your library
Click here to scan a barcode
Click here to go to notes tab

You can add all sort of comments here. For example, if you want to indicate that you lent your book to John, just indicate "lent to" as comment title and "John" as content.

The number of comments is unlimited, therefore you can really add anything you want (price, condition, language, whatever). Just click on the "+" icon near the comment field once you've added your first comment to add a new one.
Click here to go back to information tab and end this tutorial

You are one our most devoted users. By rating the app 5 stars on Google Play, you support the creation of this independent, free and ad-free application.\n\nWould you like to rate My Library on Google Play?
Can I read books within My Library?

No! As stated in the Google Play description, My Library is an app that allows you to list and sort your library. It is not a book reader. There are a lot of book readers on Android but My Library is not one of them.
How can I indicate that I lent my book to a friend?
Use the comments section: if your friend\'s name is John, then indicate \"Lent to\" as \"comment title\" and \"John\" as \"comment content\".
How can I delete a book?
Just long press the book, and you will be able to delete it.
How can I move an item from my wishlist to my library?
Just long press the item in the wishlist, and you will be able to move it to your library.
Can I have an infinite number of books in my library?
I already add all my comics to the book list and I want to use the comic list!
No worries, just long press a book / a comic and you will be able to convert books to comics and comics to books instantly!
I don\'t want to use the comic list, I want to have a single list with my books and my comics
No problem, you can still add comics to the book list :)
What is the wanted ISBN format?

An example of valid ISBN : 2–07–042277–1
The dashes are accepted for readability matters, but they are not mandatory, therefore you will get the same result with 2070422771. Give it a try!
How does the app match books and ISBN numbers?

My Library uses Google, Amazon, Open Library, IsbnPlus, Worldcat and Biblio services in order to match ISBN numbers and the books you are looking for, therefore if an ISBN number is not found, it is because it is not referenced within those services. Unfortunately this is out of my reach, but I\'ll keep an eye on new available book services, and rest assured, the best ones will be added in future updates.
Can I improve the app database by any mean?
Yes you can! Just create an account at Open Library and start adding books!
How can I save my data?

You have many ways to save your data, which can be divided in two categories: the database and the covers. For details on covers export / import, go to the next question. You can:

- Export \"mylibrary.db\" file. This is your database. You cannot read it but you can import your data on any other device with nothing else but with file.

- Export \"MyLibrary.xls\" file. This file is an Excel representation of your database. You can do whatever you want with it and use it to recover your data with XLS import if you want. I would not recommend to use XLS import if you can use database import instead but you\'re a free human being so do as you like!

- Export \"MyLibraryByAuthor.xls\" file. This file is similar to \"MyLibrary.xls\" file but is sorted by author. It cannot be imported.

When importing, you can choose to \"override current library\". If this is checked, then all your current data will be deleted and replaced by the imported one. If not checked, all the imported data will be merged to your current data. This can be very useful if you want to scan your library with multiple phones and then merge data, but be aware that this can result in doubles.
How can I export / import my covers from one device to another?

Images are big files, therefore it is not possible to store them directly in the database. To transfer them from one device to another, you now have two options:

1- Directly use the export function to create MyLibraryImages.txt, which is a single file representing all your images. Please, be aware that this file can be very big (usually about 1.5Mo for every 10 elements but it can be more), therefore be sure that you have enough space on your phone or the export will probably fail. To recover your images, put the MyLibraryImages.txt file in the \"Download\" folder of your new device then use the import function (do not forget to check the dedicated checkbox).

2- Just copy the \"MyLibrary\" folder (that is next to the \"Download\" folder) from your original device to your second device. Once this is done, the app will be able to show your covers on your new device if you made an \"mylibrary.db\" import with override. This won\'t work if you imported your data from an XLS file because XLS files cannot persist database ids and database ids are linked to covers.
What is the required format (sheet names, column names, etc.) to make a successful Excel import?

The Excel file to import must have a particular format to be successfully imported. The best way to check this format is to add at least one book to your library, then make an Excel export and look at the format of the exported Excel file. The exported file format is the same as the required import format.
My exported XLS file is not complete!
The XLS file is fine, the problem comes from your computer : just unplug your phone from it and replug it, that should solve your issue.
I can\'t find my comics in my XLS library
They are in the second sheet of the file, check it out ;)
What type of file \'mylibrary.db\' is? Can I read it from my computer?

\'mylibrary.db\' is a database file corresponding to your library. You can read it on a computer with SqliteBrowser, then export it as a CSV file, but I recommend to use the in-app XLS export instead.
Why is it important to rate the app 5 stars on Google Play if you like it?

By rating the app 5 stars on Google Play, you support the creation of this independent, free and ad-free application. I am developping it on my free time so please, if you like it, do not hesitate! You can click here to rate it.
Is there any other way to help the application?

Yes! If you buy books directly with the Amazon links that are in your wishlist, I will receive a very small percentage of the transaction (usually less than 0.5$). You will pay the same price so it will make no difference to you, but it could make a difference to me. Therefore if you usually buy books on Amazon, do not hesitate to do it within My Library. Thank you!
The answer to my question is not here!

If you are sure that your question is not answered here or within the app\'s description, you can send me a personal email and I will answer you. But please note that I am a single developer working on my free time and that I receive dozens of emails every day, therefore it may take some time before you get a answer. You will be able to find my email on Google Play.
Where can I read the privacy policies of My Library?
We are updating your application. Please do not close the app.
My Library has successfully been updated!
